message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with spiking neural networks and their implementation in emerging in-memory computing hardware, which falls under the category of neuromorphic engineering (cs.ET). The focus of the paper is on reducing the energy consumption of the network, which is a common goal in the field of machine learning (cs.AI) and specifically in neural networks (cs.NE). The paper also discusses the use of Spike Timing Dependent Plasticity (STDP) for pruning connections, which is a common technique in the field of computational neuroscience (cs.SY). Finally, the paper evaluates the performance of the network on image recognition tasks, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG).
